BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: A dangerous avalanche situation will be encountered over a wide area.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The danger of wet avalanches will already exist in the early morning. As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of wet avalanches being released will increase appreciably. This applies on steep sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on steep, rather lightly snow-covered shady slopes below approximately 2600 m. The danger of wet avalanches during the day is within the upper range of danger level 3 (considerable).
On steep grassy slopes more medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

In isolated cases wet avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach large size. In steep gullies avalanches can in isolated cases reach valley bottoms at relatively high altitudes. Backcountry tours and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack will be wet all the way through. This applies on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2500 m. The weather will be very warm. Up to 3000 m rain will fall in some localities.
The surface of the snowpack will cool hardly at all during the overcast night and will already be soft in the early morning. The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing and thorough wetting of the snowpack. This situation will give rise to a loss of strength within the snowpack, especially on steep shady slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Decrease in danger of wet avalanches as the temperature drops.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: A dangerous avalanche situation will be encountered over a wide area.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The danger of wet avalanches will already exist in the early morning. As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of wet avalanches being released will increase appreciably. This applies on steep sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on steep, rather lightly snow-covered shady slopes below approximately 2600 m. The danger of wet avalanches during the day is within the upper range of danger level 3 (considerable).
On steep grassy slopes more medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.

In isolated cases wet avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach large size. In steep gullies avalanches can in isolated cases reach valley bottoms at relatively high altitudes. Backcountry tours and ascents to alpine cabins should be started and concluded very early.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack will be wet all the way through. This applies on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2500 m. The weather will be very warm. Up to 3000 m rain will fall in some localities.
The surface of the snowpack will cool hardly at all during the overcast night and will already be soft in the early morning. The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing and thorough wetting of the snowpack. This situation will give rise to a loss of strength within the snowpack, especially on steep shady slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Decrease in danger of wet avalanches as the temperature drops.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be partly cloudy. As a consequence of warming during the day the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The weather will be mild. As a consequence of warming, the activity of small and medium moist avalanches has gradually increased. This applies in particular on very steep slopes above approximately 2000 m, as well as at the base of rock walls. In addition from the late morning in all aspects, an increasing number of medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large wet avalanches are possible. In particular on shady slopes the avalanches can penetrate even deep layers. The clearly visible wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence in all aspects at high altitude. Backcountry tourers or freeriders can release avalanches easily.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The surface of the snowpack will soften during the day. As a consequence of warming during the day the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses. The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust only at high altitudes and will soften during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Above approximately 1500 m snow will fall on Tuesday in some localities. As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind from variable directions, wind slabs will form in particular adjacent to ridgelines as well as above the tree line.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The sometimes large wind slabs of the last few days can still be released in some cases in particular on wind-protected shady slopes above approximately 2800 m.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day there will be an increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. Below approximately 2800 m medium-sized to large wet loose snow avalanches are possible. In particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain sometimes large wind slabs formed.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Towards its surface, the snowpack is moist and its surface has a strong crust. As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day there will be an increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. In particular adjacent to ridgelines as well as at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be cloudy in some regions. Wet snow represents the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In some regions light snowfall at intermediate altitudes. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze. The spring-like weather conditions will give rise to thorough wetting of the snowpack, in the event of prolonged bright spells especially in steep rocky terrain.
Wet avalanches can sometimes be released by a single winter sport participant. Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised as well in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.
In starting zones where no previous releases have taken place and at intermediate and high altitudes individual medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large moist and wet avalanches are possible. These can also be released in near-ground layers.

Individual gliding avalanches can also occur, in particular on very steep grassy slopes. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided as far as possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Night: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be reduced.
Sunday: Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise from the middle of the day to rapid moistening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 3500 m. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
Above approximately 2300 m a lot of snow is lying.
In the last few days on very steep slopes further medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches were reported.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be cloudy. Light snowfall. Gradual decrease in danger of moist and wet avalanches as the temperature drops.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The snowpack will be favourable over a wide area. A clear night will be followed in the early morning by favourable conditions generally.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Gradual decrease in danger of moist and wet avalanches as the temperature drops. Only isolated avalanches are possible as the day progresses. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on rocky slopes.
The wind slabs of last week can still be released in some cases at elevated altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack consists of rounded crystals. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust. The spring-like weather conditions will give rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be cloudy. Over a wide area light precipitation.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The weather will be mild. The avalanche prone locations are to be found at the base of rock walls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Gliding avalanches can also occur, in particular on steep grassy slopes.
The wind slabs remain for the foreseeable future prone to triggering, especially adjacent to ridgelines. In all regions medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible.
Avalanches can be released, mostly by large loads.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The weather conditions gave rise to thorough wetting of the snowpack over a wide area.
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be reduced.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Over a wide area precipitation. The weather will be cold in some localities.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation numerous medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large wet avalanches are possible as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Moist and wet avalanches and gliding avalanches and wet snow slides are to be expected in particular during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The backcountry touring conditions in the morning, after a clear night, are spring-like.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Gradual decrease in danger of moist and wet avalanches as the temperature drops. Only isolated avalanches are possible as the day progresses. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on rocky slopes.
The wind slabs of last week can still be released in some cases above approximately 2500 m.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack consists of rounded crystals. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust and will soften during the day. In the last few days numerous small and medium-sized avalanches were observed.

At intermediate and high altitudes there is more snow than usual.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be very mild. Wet and gliding snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming during the day small to medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible above approximately 1700 m. In particular on shady slopes the avalanches can penetrate even deep layers. Weakly bonded old snow and wet snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack will be generally moist. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already be soft in the early morning.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs will become increasingly prone to triggering.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be very warm. The danger of wet avalanches will increase during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of wet avalanches will gradually increase. On steep grassy slopes mostly small gliding avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already be soft in the early morning.

Below approximately 1800 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Conditions are favorable concerning avalanche hazard.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be cloudy. Over a wide area light precipitation.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on shady slopes at elevated altitudes. Mostly small avalanches are possible in particular on steep shady slopes. Avalanches can be released, mostly by large loads in isolated cases.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be reduced.
On sunny slopes no snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Over a wide area precipitation. The weather will be cold in some localities.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be very warm. The danger of wet avalanches will increase during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of wet avalanches will gradually increase. On steep grassy slopes mostly small gliding avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already be soft in the early morning.

Below approximately 1800 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Conditions are favorable concerning avalanche hazard.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet snow slides and avalanches are possible in isolated cases. Mostly these are small.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Above approximately 2000 m: In gullies and bowls mostly small wet snow slides and avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Below approximately 1900 m hardly any snow is lying. The old snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations. The older wind slabs are to be found especially in gullies and bowls and at high altitudes. The snowpack will be generally moist.
